example_answers: It can run / jump / swim / fly / tunnel / glide / catapult / jet / etc. at great speeds or to a great distance.
It can transport itself / others by means of ___.
It easily overcomes obstacles such as ___.
concept.initial_blurb: Think about your Mythos. In the legend, did your Mythos travel from one place to another in a miraculous way? Did she possess the power to transport or move others? Did she display the ability to avoid or escape confinement?
concept.question: How does your Mythos move you or others?

improvements.description: When you Take the Risk with power tags from this theme, it's Dynamite!
improvements.name: Nine Lives

improvements.description: Once per session, when you or someone rolls 6 or less and the MC makes a move, you can make a single (additional) move before the MC's move takes place. You move is considered to precede the MC's move and can affect or even nullify it (e.g., by reducing its tier, granting you a status, or simply changing the circumstances).
improvements.name: Do Try To Keep Up

improvements.description: Once per session, you can have your character show up or already be at a scene anywhere in the City (including cutscenes). Alternately, you can ask the MC to start a scene anywhere in the City, with your character present.
improvements.name: Ain't No Mountain High Enough

improvements.description: You can stop just before things get messy. Once per scene, when you score a 7-9 on Take the Risk, after hearing the MC's hard bargain or ugly choice, you can choose to forego the success of your feat and walk away unharmed.
improvements.name: Hit the Brakes

improvements.description: Once per session, if you can ready yourself for an action involving your mobility powers, you can choose to take an appropriate tier-2 status.
improvements.name: Rev Up

example_answers: (Tlaloc) "Who can I trust to protect the Fifth Sun?"
(Jack and the Beanstalk) "What is up there?"
prompts: Questions about things that are hidden or inaccessible in the City
Wondering how far, how fast, or how deep you can travel
Seeking a way to outrun or outmaneuver a threat

example_answers: emerge out of bodies of water
A.question: What is your Mythos' most useful form of movement?

example_answers: merge with a large mass of water
B.question: How do you go into overdrive?

C.question: What allows you to avoid restraints or confinement?

example_answers: roots can tunnel into the earth
D.question: What secondary mode of movement have you learned to use?

E.question: What style or technique of movement have you mastered?

F.question: What specific harmful effects does your mobility allow you to avoid?

G.question: How do you use your mobility to gain advantage in a fight?

example_answers: the strength to carry a bull
H.question: What allows you to move others?

I.question: How can you use your powers to restrain others' movement?

J.question: What special resource does your mobility give you access to?

example_answers: Whether out of love, greed, power-trip, or concern, one of them is trying to slow you down, constrict your movement or freedom of action, or tie you down. Why? And how do they do so? Take a Hurt point on them.

You took one of them on a âmagic carpet rideâ, a trip they will never forget. What happened there? Ask them if it made them feel closer to you. If so, take a Help point on them. If they kept their distance since, take a Hurt point on them.
One of them once pushed you to go as fast or as far as you can. What were the circumstances? If it ended well, take a Help point on them. If it ended badly, take a Hurt point on them.
(Tlaloc) Wherever there is water, there I am.

A.question: What impedes you or slows you down?

B.question: What happens when you go too fast, too far, etc.?

example_answers: flickers in and out of time
D.question: What residual evidence does your movement leave on you, on others, or in the environment?
